title: Did Hakka people invent lei cha? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. They’re simply one of three (3) Han Chinese sub-ethnics that still practice the ancient culture of Lei Cha. Lei Cha originated from the era when Han Chinese first drank tea where they pounded it into powder before adding hot water to dissolve it. Such culture become obsolete eventually and the Han Chinese just simply brewed tea leaves without making it into a powder. That very same culture was also the origin of Japan’s Matcha.
